characteristics: Seen as a sight hound which are typically long and lean with keen vision.
behaviors: Reserved, even considered shy. Very gentle. They are amazing runners, of course.
concerns: Hip, neck and joint problems are common especially in ex-racers.

characteristics: Considered to be a protection dog.
behaviors: Confident, extremely trainable, playful, and works well with hoomans.
concerns: Prone to eye diseases most likely due to their facial structure.

characteristics: Typically viewed as a companion dog.
behaviors: Can be considered a stage five clinger towards their hoomans.
concerns: Hip dysplasia, progressive retinal atrophy and vocal problems are common with poodles.
